title: Can quantum-mechanical description of physical reality be considered complete?
text:
Abstract
In a complete theory there is an element corresponding to each element of reality. A sufficient condition for the reality of a physical quantity is the possibility of predicting it with certainty, without disturbing the system. In quantum mechanics in the case of two physical quantities described by non-commuting operators, the knowledge of one precludes the knowledge of the other. Then either (1) the description of reality given by the wave function in quantum mechanics is not complete or (2) these two quantities cannot have simultaneous reality. Consideration of the problem of making predictions concerning a system on the basis of measurements made on another system that had previously interacted with it leads to the result that if (1) is false then (2) is also false. One is thus led to conclude that the description of reality as given by a wave function is not complete.

I am a senior researcher in the Global Governance unit of the WZB Berlin Social Science Center and a Professor for the ‘Politics of Multilevel Governance’ at the University of Potsdam.
My research and teaching interests lie at the intersection of EU studies, comparative politics, and international relations. Focus areas include:

Decision-making of and in the European Commission
Public debates about European and international institutions
The EU’s role in the international order

My work combines solid theory with innovative empirical analysis. Luckily, this often involves the more immediate gratifications of a little programming, quantitative text analysis, and data visualization.

Please do have a look and get in touch!

title: Data and resources
text:
General purpose data and tools

ParlLawSpeech - Linked full-text corpora of 43,582 bills, 28,124 laws, and 3,092,431 plenary speeches from eight European parliaments - Schwalbach / Hetzer / Proksch / Rauh / Sebők
ParlSpeech V2 - Full-text corpora of 6.3 million parliamentary speeches in the key legislative chambers of nine representative democracies - Rauh / Schwalbach
ParlSpeech - Full-text corpora of 3.9 million plenary speeches in seven European states - Rauh / De Wilde / Schwalbach
EU Commissioner speeches - Full-text of corpus of all 13,618 speeches between 1985 and 2020
EU Commission press releases - Full-text corpus of all 44,978 press releases published between January 17, 1985, and January 8, 2021
Sentiment dicitionary for German political language
PastTwitter - R functions to scrape and plot Twitter account info for past points in time from web.archive.org snapshots
ShinyApps for human coding of text snippets
ShinyApps for descriptive analysis and sharing of text corpora
